botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort. May cause skin irritation. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Helleborus can be rhizomatous, herbaceous or semi-evergreen perennials forming a clump of pedate basal leaves, or evergreen with erect, leafy stems. Large, bowl-shaped flowers are borne in loose clusters in late winter or spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Thrives in neutral to alkaline soils that are moist, fertile and humus-rich. Partial shade is ideal but can tolerate full sun. Provide shelter from strong, cold winds. Mulch annually in autumn.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division in spring or summer. Usually comes true from seed.
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove faded or damaged foliage as the flowers appear
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to Hellebore aphid, hellebore leaf miner and snail, particularly on developing flower buds.
how_to_grow.diseases: May be subject to hellebore leaf spot and hellebore black death
